title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
OPEC failed in its third attempt to resolve a deadlock over oil production after divisions between Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates spilled out in public and into global markets.

---

Didi has been hit with regulatory action in China after pushing ahead with an NYSE listing despite concerns in Beijing about U.S. access to its data.

Facebook, Twitter and Google warned Hong Kong they could stop service there if planned rules to address doxing put their staff at risk of criminal investigation.

---

Damage from a freeze in Texas and other states in February is expected to cost insurance companies $18 billion.

---

A bid for Sydney Airport of nearly $17 billion signals investors are willing to bet big on post-pandemic travel.

---

Midsize drug firms are the big deal makers this year, as new sources of capital emerge.

---

Apollo is considering a bid for U.K. grocery chain Morrisons, setting up a potential three-way bidding war with SoftBank's Fortress and Clayton, Dubilier & Rice.

---

Ad spending has shifted since Apple began requiring apps to get iPhone and iPad users' permission to track them.
